question: Question 1 In the circuit shown, the diodes are ideal, the inductance is small, and  [latex]I_o \neq 0[/latex]. Which one of the following statements is true?
solution: Both diodes will conduct for more than [latex]180^{\circ}[/latex].

options.A: [latex]D_1[/latex] conducts for greater than 180[latex]^\circ[/latex] and [latex]D_2[/latex] conducts for greater than 180[latex]^\circ[/latex]
options.B: [latex]D_2[/latex]  conducts for more than 180[latex]^\circ[/latex] and [latex]D_1[/latex]  conducts for 180[latex]^\circ[/latex]
options.D: [latex]D_1[/latex]  conducts for more than 180[latex]^\circ[/latex] and [latex]D_2[/latex]  conducts for 180[latex]^\circ[/latex]

question: Question 2 For a 3-input logic circuit shown below, the output Z can be expressed as
solution: [latex]Z=\overline{\overline{P\bar{Q}}\cdot Q\cdot \overline{Q\cdot R} } [/latex] [latex]\;\;=P\bar{Q}+\bar{Q}+Q R [/latex] [latex]\;\;=\bar{Q}(P+1)+QR [/latex] [latex]\;\;=\bar{Q}+QR [/latex] [latex]\;\;=(\bar{Q}+Q)(\bar{Q}+R) [/latex] [latex]\;\;=\bar{Q}+R[/latex]

question:
Question 3 An urn contains 5 red balls and 5 black balls. In the first draw, one ball is picked at random and
discarded without noticing its colour. The probability to get a red ball in the second draw is
solution: [latex]P(red)=\frac{5}{10}\frac{4}{9}+\frac{5}{10}\frac{5}{9}=\frac{45}{90}=\frac{1}{2}[/latex]

question:
Question 4 When a unit ramp input is applied to the unity feedback system having closed loop transfer
function [latex]\frac{C(s)}{R(s)}=\frac{Ks+b}{s^{2}+as+b}(a \gt 0,b \gt 0,K\gt 0)[/latex], the steady state error will be
solution: Closed loop transfer function [latex]=\frac{Ks+b}{s^2+as+b} [/latex] Open loop transfer function [latex]= G(s)=\frac{Ks+b}{s^2+as+b-Ks-b} [/latex] [latex]G(s)=\frac{Ks+b}{s^2+as-Ks} =\frac{Ks+b}{s(s+a-K)} [/latex] Steady state error for ramp input given to type-1 system [latex]=1/K_V[/latex] where, velocity error coefficient, [latex]K_V=\lim_{s \to 0}s\cdot \frac{Ks+b}{s(s+a-K)} =\frac{b}{a-K}[/latex] Steady state error, [latex] e_{ss}=\frac{a-K}{b}[/latex]

question:
Question 5 A three-phase voltage source inverter with ideal devices operating in 180[latex]^{\circ}[/latex] conduction mode is
feeding a balanced star-connected resistive load. The DC voltage input is [latex]V_{dc}[/latex]. The peak of the
fundamental component of the phase voltage is
solution: [latex]3-\phi \;\text{ VSI }180^{\circ} \text{ mode:}[/latex] [latex]\begin{aligned} V_{Rn}&=\frac{6 V_{dc}/3}{n \pi} \sin n\omega t\\ &= \frac{2 \times V_{dc}}{n \pi} \sin n\omega t \\ V_{Rn} &= \frac{2 V_{dc}}{ \pi} \sin \omega t \end{aligned}[/latex]

question:
Question 6 The figures show diagrammatic representations of vector fields [latex]\vec{X},\vec{Y}[/latex] and [latex]\vec{Z}[/latex] respectively.
Which one of the following choices is true?

Question 7 Assume that in a traffic junction, the cycle of the traffic signal lights is 2 minutes of green
(vehicle does not stop) and 3 minutes of red (vehicle stops). Consider that the arrival time of
vehicles at the junction is uniformly distributed over 5 minute cycle. The expected waiting time
(in minutes) for the vehicle at the junction is ________.
solution: [latex]t[/latex] be arrival time of vehicles of the junction is uniformaly distributed in [0,5]. Let y be the waiting time of the junction. [latex]\begin{aligned} \text{Then }y&=\left\{\begin{matrix} 0 &  t \lt 2  \\ 5-t & 2\leq t \lt 5 \end{matrix}\right.\\ y\rightarrow &[0,5]\\ f(y)&=\frac{1}{5-0}=\frac{1}{5}\\ E(y)&=\int_{-\infty }^{0}y(y)dy=\int_{0}^{5}yf(y)dy\\ &=\int_{2}^{5}y\left ( \frac{1}{5} \right )dy=\frac{1}{5}\int_{2}^{5}(5-t)dt\\ &=\frac{1}{5}\left ( 5t-\frac{t^2}{2} \right )|_2^5\\ &=\frac{1}{5}\left [ \left ( 25-\frac{25}{2} \right )-\left ( 10-\frac{4}{2} \right ) \right ]\\ &=\frac{1}{5}\left ( \frac{25}{2}-8 \right )=\frac{1}{5}\frac{9}{2}=0.9 \end{aligned}[/latex]

question:
Question 8 Consider a solid sphere of radius 5 cm made of a perfect electric conductor. If one million
electrons are added to this sphere, these electrons will be distributed.
solution: Added charge (one million electrons) to be solid spherical conductor is uniformly distributed over the outer surface of the sphere.

options.A: uniformly over the entire volume of the sphere
options.B: uniformly over the outer surface of the sphere
options.C: concentrated around the centre of the sphere
options.D: along a straight line passing through the centre of the sphere

question: Question 9 The transfer function C(s) of a compensator is given below. [latex]C(s)=\frac{(1+\frac{s}{0.1})(1+\frac{s}{100})}{(1+s)(1+\frac{s}{10})}[/latex] The frequency range in which the phase (lead) introduced by the compensator reaches the maximum is
solution: Pole zero diagram of compensator transfer function is shown below. Maximum phase lead is between 0.1 and 1. [latex]0.1 \lt \omega \lt 1[/latex]

question:
Question 10 The figure show the per-phase representation of a phase-shifting transformer connected between buses 1 and 2, where [latex]\alpha[/latex] is a complex number with non-zero real and imaginary parts. For the given circuit, [latex]Y_{bus}\; and \; Z_{bus}[/latex] are bus admittance matrix and bus impedance matrix,
respectively, each of size 2x2. Which one of the following statements is true?
solution: Both [latex]Y_{BUS}[/latex] and [latex]Z_{BUS}[/latex] are unsymmetrical with transformer.

options.B: [latex]Y_{bus}[/latex] is symmetric and bus [latex]Z_{bus}[/latex] is unsymmetric

question:
Question 11 A phase-controlled, single-phase, full-bridge converter is supplying a highly inductive DC load.
The converter is fed from a 230 V, 50 Hz, AC source. The fundamental frequency in Hz of the
voltage ripple on the DC side is
solution: All even harmonics are present. Fundamental frequency [latex]=2f_s=2 \times 50=100 Hz[/latex]

question: Question 12 Let x and y be integers satisfying the following equations [latex]2x^{2}+y^{2}=34[/latex] [latex]x+2y=11[/latex] The value of (x+y) is ________.

Question 13 Consider a function f (x, y,z) given by [latex]f(x,y,z)=(x^{2}+y^{2}-2z^{2})(y^{2}+z^{2})[/latex] The partial derivative of this function with respect to x at the point, x = 2, y = 1 and z = 3 is ________
solution: [latex]\begin{aligned} f(x,y,z)&=(x^2+y^2-2z^2)(y^2+z^2)\\ \frac{\partial f}{\partial x}&=(x^2+y^2-2z^2)(0)+(y^2+z^2)(2x)\\ &=0+(y^2+z^2)(2x)\\ \left.\begin{matrix} \frac{\partial f}{\partial x} \end{matrix}\right|_{x=2,y=1,z=3}&=(1+9)(2)(2)=40 \end{aligned}[/latex]

question: Question 14 For the given 2-port network, the value of transfer impedance [latex]Z_{21}[/latex] in ohms is_______
solution: Where, [latex]R_A=1\Omega [/latex] [latex]R_B=1\Omega[/latex] [latex] R_C=\frac{1}{2}\Omega[/latex] After rearrangement consider the following circuit, From the circuit diagram, we get, [latex]Z_{21}=\frac{V_2}{I_1}=3\Omega[/latex]

question:
Question 15 The initial charge in the 1 F capacitor present in the circuit shown is zero. The energy in joules
transferred from the DC source until steady state condition is reached equals ______. (Give the
answer up to one decimal place.)
solution: Consider the following circuit diagram, After minimizing circuit elements we can have the following circuit, Here, [latex]\tau =RC=5 sec.[/latex] Now current, [latex] i(t)=\frac{V}{R}e^{\frac{t}{\tau }}[/latex] [latex]\;\;=\frac{10}{5}e^{-t/5}=2e^{-0.2t} [/latex] Energy supplied by the source, [latex] E=\int_{0}^{\infty }10 \times 2e^{-0.2t}dt[/latex] [latex] \;\;=100J[/latex]

question:
Question 16 The figure below shows the circuit diagram of a controlled rectifier supplied from a 230 V, 50
Hz, 1-phase voltage source and a 10:1 ideal transformer. Assume that all devices are ideal. The
firing angles of the thyristors  [latex]T_1 \; and\; T_2[/latex] are [latex]90^{\circ} \; and\; 270^{\circ}[/latex], respectively. The RMS value of the current through diode [latex]D_3[/latex] in amperes is ____
solution: Diode current, [latex]I_{D3(rms)}=0[/latex] FD will not conduct for resistive load.

question:
Question 17 In a load flow problem solved by Newton-Raphson method with polar coordinates, the size of
the Jacobian is 100x100. If there are 20 PV buses in addition to PQ buses and a slack bus, the
total number of buses in the system is ________.
solution: [latex]\begin{aligned} [J]&=[2n-m-2] \\ 100&= [2n-20-2]\\ n&= 61 \end{aligned}[/latex] Total number of buses =n=61

question:
Question 18 A 3-phase, 4-pole, 400 V, 50 Hz squirrel-cage induction motor is operating at a slip of 0.02. The
speed of the rotor flux in mechanical rad/sec, sensed by a stationary observer, is closest to
solution: [latex]\begin{aligned} N_s &= \frac{120 \times 50}{4}=1500\; \text{rpm}\\ s &=0.02 \\ N&=N_s(1-s) \\ &=1500(1-0.02) \\ &=1470 \; \text{rpm} \end{aligned} [/latex] As it was specified rotor rmf with respect to stationary part/sector. Rotor rmf w.r.t. stator is always at [latex]N_s.[/latex] [latex] \therefore \;[/latex]  Speed of rotor flux in mechanical radian/sec. [latex] =\frac{2 \times 3.14 \times 1500}{60}=157 \; rad/sec[/latex]

question:
Question 19 Two resistors with nominal resistance values [latex]R_1 \; and\; R_2[/latex] have additive uncertainties
 [latex]\Delta R_1[/latex] and [latex]\Delta R_2[/latex], respectively. When these resistances are connected in parallel, the standard deviation of the error in the equivalent resistance R is
solution: [latex]\begin{aligned} \sigma _{res} &= \sqrt{\left ( \frac{\partial R}{\partial R_1} \right )^2 \sigma _1^2+\left ( \frac{\partial R}{\partial R_2} \right )^2 \sigma _2^2} \\ &= \sqrt{\left ( \frac{\partial R}{\partial R_1} \right )^2 \Delta R_1^2+\left ( \frac{\partial R}{\partial R_2} \right )^2 \Delta R_2^2} \end{aligned}[/latex]

options.A: [latex]\pm \sqrt{\left \{ \frac{\partial R}{\partial R_1}\Delta R_1 \right \}^2+\left \{ \frac{\partial R}{\partial R_2}\Delta R_2 \right \}^2}[/latex]
options.B: [latex]\pm \sqrt{\left \{ \frac{\partial R}{\partial R_2}\Delta R_1 \right \}^2+\left \{ \frac{\partial R}{\partial R_1}\Delta R_2 \right \}^2}[/latex]
options.C: [latex]\pm \sqrt{\left \{ \frac{\partial R}{\partial R_1}\right \}^2 \Delta R_2 +\left \{ \frac{\partial R}{\partial R_2} \right \}^2 \Delta R_1}[/latex]
options.D: [latex]\pm \sqrt{\left \{ \frac{\partial R}{\partial R_1}\right \}^2 \Delta R_1 +\left \{ \frac{\partial R}{\partial R_2} \right \}^2 \Delta R_2}[/latex]

question:
Question 20 The nominal- [latex]\pi[/latex] circuit of a transmission line is shown in the figure. Impedance [latex]Z=100\angle 80^{\circ}\Omega[/latex] and reactance X=3300[latex]\Omega[/latex]. The magnitude of the characteristic
impedance of the transmission line, in [latex]\Omega[/latex], is _______________. (Give the answer up to one
decimal place.)
solution: [latex]\begin{aligned} Z&=100\angle 80^{\circ}\Omega \\ X&=3300\Omega \\ \frac{y}{2}&=\frac{1}{X}=\frac{1}{3300} \end{aligned}[/latex] [latex]\begin{aligned} y&=\frac{2}{3300}=6.06 \times 10^{-4}\\ Z_C&=\sqrt{\frac{Z}{y}}=\sqrt{\frac{100}{6.06 \times 10^{-4}}}\\ &=406.2\Omega \end{aligned}[/latex]

question:
Question 21 The pole-zero plots of three discrete-time systems P, Q and R on the z-plane are shown below.
Which one of the following is TRUE about the frequency selectivity of these systems?
solution: Since all 3 pole-zero plots have zero at z=1 and z=-1. So, filter will not pass low frequency and high frequency components. Therefore all are bandpass filter. Note: in digital filter For low frequency z=1 For high frequency z=-1

options.D: P is a low-pass filter, Q is a band-pass filter and R is a high-pass filter.

question: Question 22 The mean square value of the given periodic waveform f(t) is_________
solution: Mean square value = power of f(t) Mean square value [latex]\begin{aligned} &=\frac{1}{T_0}\int_{T_0} |f(t)|^2 dt\\ &= \frac{1}{4}[4^2 \times 1+2^2 \times 2]\\ &= \frac{16+8}{4}=6 \end{aligned}[/latex]

question:
Question 23 A stationary closed Lissajous pattern on an oscilloscope has 3 horizontal tangencies and 2
vertical tangencies for a horizontal input with frequency 3 kHZ. The frequency of the vertical
input is
solution: [latex]\begin{aligned} \frac{f_y}{f_x} &= \frac{\text{Horizontal Tangencies}}{\text{VerticalTangencies}}\\ \Rightarrow \; \frac{f_y}{3} &=\frac{3 }{2}\\ \Rightarrow \; f_y&= 4.5kHz \end{aligned}[/latex]

question: Question 24 Let [latex]y^{2}-2y+1=x[/latex] and [latex]\sqrt{x}+y=5[/latex]. The value of [latex]x+\sqrt{y}[/latex] equals _________. (Give the answer up to three decimal places)
solution: [latex]\begin{aligned} \sqrt{x}+y&=5\\ \sqrt{x}+1+5x&=5\\ 2\sqrt{x}&=4\\ x&=4\\ y^2-2y+1&=x\\ (y-1)^2&=x\\ y-1&=\sqrt{x}\\ y&=1+\sqrt{x}\\ y&=1+\sqrt{4}=3\\ \therefore \;\;x+\sqrt{y}&=4+\sqrt{3}=5.732 \end{aligned}[/latex]

question: Question 25 If a synchronous motor is running at a leading power factor, its excitation induced voltage ([latex]E_f[/latex]) is
solution: Synchonnous motor-leading p.f. over excited. [latex]\therefore \;\;E_f \gt V_t[/latex]

question: Question 26 Which of the following systems has maximum peak overshoot due to a unit step input?
solution: For maximum peak over shoot [latex]M_P\propto \frac{1}{\xi}[/latex] [latex]\xi=0.25[/latex] for option (C) which is least among all options. Therefore correct option is C.

question:
Question 27 Consider an overhead transmission line with 3-phase, 50 Hz balanced system with conductors located at the vertices of an equilateral triangle of length [latex]D_{ab}=D_{bc}=D_{ca}=1m[/latex] as shown in figure below. The resistance of the conductors are neglected. The geometric mean radius (GMR) of
each conductor is 0.01m. Neglecting the effect of ground, the magnitude of positive sequence reactance in [latex]\Omega[/latex]/ km (rounded off to three decimal places) is ________
solution: [latex]\begin{aligned} X_L&=2 \pi f L\\&=2 \pi f \times 2 \times 10^{-7} \ln \left ( \frac{D_m}{D_s} \right )\\ &=2 \pi \times 50 \times 2 \times 10^{-7} \ln \left ( \frac{1}{0.01} \right )\\ &=2.89 \times 10^{-4}\Omega /m\\ X_L&=0.289 \Omega /km \end{aligned}[/latex]

question:
Question 28 Two generating units rated 300 MW and 400 MW have governor speed regulation of 6% and
4% respectively from no load to full load. Both the generating units are operating in parallel to
share a load of 600 MW. Assuming free governor action, the load shared by the larger unit is
_______ MW.
solution: Given: speed regulation of generating unit is from no load to full load. Hence, the rated frequency (50 Hz) will be common for both units at no load nad will drop to lower value as loaded to full load. Let,  [latex]P_1=[/latex] Load shared by 400 MW machine [latex]P_2=[/latex] Load shred by 300 MW machine For 400 MW machine drop in frequency from no load to full load [latex]=\frac{50 \times 4}{100}=2 Hz[/latex] New frequecy of operation of 400 MW machine, [latex]f_1=50-\frac{2}{400}P_1[/latex] For 300 MW machine drop in frequency from no load to full load [latex]=\frac{50 \times 6}{100}=3 Hz[/latex] New frequecy of operation of 300 MW machine, [latex]f_2=50-\frac{3}{300}P_2[/latex] we also know, [latex]\begin{aligned} P_1+P_2&=600 \\\ (\text{Load shared }& \text{between shared units})\\ P_2&=600-P_1 \\ f_1&=f_2=f \\ (\text{Units operatio }& \text{ is in parallel})  \\ 50-\frac{2}{400}P_1 &=50-\frac{3}{300}(600-P_1) \\ \frac{P_1}{200}&=\frac{600-P_1}{100} \\ 100P_1 &=200(600-P_1) \\ P_1&=1200-2P_1\\ 3P_1&=1200\\ P_1&=400 MW \end{aligned}[/latex]

question: Question 29 For the network given in figure below, the Thevenin's voltage [latex]V_{ab}[/latex] is
solution: Consider the following circuit, After rearrangement, we get, From circuit using KCL, [latex]\frac{V_{ab}+30}{15}+\frac{V_{ab}-8}{5}=0 [/latex] [latex]V_{ab}+30+3V_{ab}-24=0 [/latex] [latex]V_{ab}=-1.5V[/latex]

question:
Question 30 The output y(t) of the following system is to be sampled, so as to reconstruct it from its samples
uniquely. The required minimum sampling rate is
solution: From the above block diagram, [latex]Z(t)=x(t) \cos 1000 \pi t[/latex] By using modulation property of fourier transform, [latex]Z(\omega )=\frac{1}{2}[X(\omega + 1000 \pi t)+X(\omega - 1000 \pi t)][/latex] Now, [latex]h(t)=\frac{\sin 1500 \pi t}{\pi t}=1500 Sa(1500 \pi t)[/latex] Thus, [latex]H(\omega )[/latex] is a low pass filter and it will pass frequency, component of [latex]Z(\omega )[/latex] upto [latex]1500 \pi [/latex] rad/sec. Therefore, maximum frequency component of [latex]y(t)[/latex] is [latex]\omega _m =1500 \pi[/latex] rad/sec  or [latex]f_m =750 Hz[/latex] So, the minimum sampling rate for [latex]y(t)[/latex] is [latex]f_{s\; min}=2f_m=1500Hz=1500[/latex] samples/sec

question:
Question 31 A 220 V, 10 kW, 900 rpm separately excited DC motor has an armature resistance [latex]R_a=0.02\Omega[/latex].
When the motor operates at rated speed and with rated terminal voltage, the electromagnetic
torque developed by the motor is 70 Nm. Neglecting the rotational losses of the machine, the
current drawn by the motor from the 220 V supply is
solution:
[latex]\begin{aligned}
\text{Neglecting rotor loss,}&\\
E_bI_a &= 10kW\\ 
(V-I_aR_a)I_a &= 10kW\\ 
(220-I_a(0.02))I_a &= 10000\\ 
220I_a-0.02I_a^2-10000 &=0 \\ 
 0.02I_a^2-220I_a+10000&=0\\
\text{By sloving,}\;\; & I_a=45.75A\\
\text{Torque corrosponding,}&\\ 
T&=\frac{60}{2\pi N}E_bI_a\\
\therefore \; T&=\frac{60}{2 \pi (900)}10000\\
&=106.15N-m
\end{aligned}[/latex] Separately excited motor, [latex]\therefore \;\;T \propto I_a[/latex] For a torque 106.15 N-m [latex]I_a=45.75A[/latex] For a torque 70 N-m, New  [latex]I_a=\frac{70 \times 45.75}{106.15}=30.16A[/latex]

question:
Question 32 A cascade system having the impulse responses [latex]h_1(n)=\{\overset{1}{\uparrow},-1\}[/latex] and [latex]h_2(n)=\{\overset{1}{\uparrow},1\}[/latex] is shown in the
figure below, where symbol [latex]\uparrow[/latex]
 denotes the time origin. The input sequence x(n) for which the cascade system produces an output sequence
[latex]y(n)=\{\overset{1}{\uparrow},2,1,-1,-2,-1\}[/latex] is
solution: Now, [latex]\begin{aligned} h(n)&=\text{overall system impulse response}\\ &=h_1(n)*h_2(n)\\ &=\{1,-1\}*\{1,1\}\\ &=\{ 1,0,-1\}\underset{*}{\rightleftharpoons }H(z)=1-z^2\\ &\text{As we know,}\\ H(z)&=\frac{Y(z)}{X(z)}\Rightarrow X(z)=\frac{Y(z)}{H(z)}\\ &=\frac{1+2z^{-1}+z^{-2}-z^{-3}-2z^{-4}-z^{-5}}{1-z^{-2}}\\ &=1+2z^{-1}+2z^{-2}+z^{-3}\\ \Rightarrow \; x(n)&=\{1,2,2,1\} \end{aligned}[/latex]

question:
Question 33 For the circuit shown in the figure below, it is given that [latex]V_{CE}=\frac{V_{CC}}{2}[/latex]. The transistor has [latex]\beta =29 [/latex] and [latex]V_{BE}=0.7V[/latex]  when the B-E junction is forward biased. For this circuit, the value of [latex]\frac{R_B}{R}[/latex]
is
solution: In the input loop, [latex]10=(1+\beta )I_B \times 4R+I_B \times R_B+0.7+(1+\beta )I_B \times R [/latex] [latex]10=30I_B \times 4R+I_B \times R_B+0.7+30 \times I_B \times R [/latex] [latex]9.3=150 \times I_B \times R +I_B \times R_B .....(i)[/latex] Ouput loop, [latex] 10=(1+\beta )I_B \times 4R+5V+(1+\beta )I_B \times R [/latex] [latex]5=30I_B \times 4R+30 \times I_B \times R [/latex] [latex]5=150 \times I_B \times R .....(ii) [/latex] using equation (i) and (ii), [latex]I_BR_B=9.3-5=4.3[/latex] and simultaneously putting value of [latex]I_B R[/latex] from equation (ii) in equation (i), [latex]9.3=I_BR\left [ 150+\frac{R_B}{R} \right ] [/latex] [latex]9.3=\frac{5}{150}\left [ 150+\frac{R_B}{R} \right ] [/latex] [latex]279=150+\frac{R_B}{R}[/latex] [latex] \frac{R_B}{R}=129[/latex]

question:
Question 34 A 3-phase, 2-pole, 50 Hz, synchronous generator has a rating of 250 MVA, 0.8 pf lagging. The
kinetic energy of the machine at synchronous speed is 1000 MJ. The machine is running
steadily at synchronous speed and delivering 60 MW power at a power angle of 10 electrical
degrees. If the load is suddenly removed, assuming the acceleration is constant for 10 cycles,
the value of the power angle after 5 cycles is ________ electrical degrees.
solution:
[latex]\begin{aligned}
 S&=250 MVA \\ 
 \cos \phi &=0.8 \\ 
K.E. &=1000MJ \\ 
 P_e&= 60MW\\ 
 \delta _0&=10^{\circ} \\ 
 t&=10\; cycles\\
&=\frac{10}{50}=0.2\; sec \\ 
 t&=5\; cycle =0.1sec \\ 
 \text{Load}&\text{ is removed,} \\ 
 P_e&=0 \\ 
 P_a&=P_m-P_e \\ 
P_m &=60MW \\ 
 M&=\frac{HS}{180f}=\frac{K.E.}{180f} \\ 
 &= \frac{1000}{180 \times 50}=0.111\\ 
 \frac{d^2 \delta }{dt^2}&=\frac{P_a}{M}=545.45 \text{ ele.degree}/s^2 \\ 
 \text{Integrating}&\text{ the above eq.} \\
\int \left ( \frac{d^2 \delta }{dt^2} \right )dt&=\int \frac{P_a}{M}dt=545.45 \times t\\
\text{Integrating}&\text{ tit once again with dt} \\
&=545.45 \times t(dt)\\
\delta &=\frac{545.45 \times t^2}{2}=2.7^{\circ}\\
\text{So, new}&\text{ value of power angle}\\
&=10^{\circ}+2.7^{\circ}=12.7^{\circ}
\end{aligned}[/latex]

question: Question 35 For the circuit shown below, assume that the OPAMP is ideal. Which one of the following is TRUE?
solution: [latex]V_A=\frac{V_s}{2} [/latex] [latex]I_3=\frac{V_A}{R}=\frac{V_s}{2R} [/latex] [latex]V_B-V_A=I_3R [/latex] [latex]V_B=V_A+I_3R=\frac{V_s}{2}+\frac{V_s}{2}=V_s [/latex] [latex]I_2=\frac{V_B}{R}=\frac{V_s}{R} [/latex] [latex]I_1=I_2+I_3 [/latex] [latex]\;\;=\frac{V_s}{R}+\frac{V_s}{2R}=\frac{V_s}{R}[1.5] [/latex] [latex]V_0-V_B=I_1R [/latex] [latex]\Rightarrow V_0=V_B+\frac{V_s}{R}[1.5]R [/latex] [latex]\;\;\;=V_s+1.5V_s=2.5V_s[/latex]

question: Question 36 The root locus of the feedback control system having the characteristic equation [latex]s^{2}+ 6Ks +2s +5 =0 \;  where \; K \gt 0[/latex], enters into the real axis at
solution: [latex]G(s)H(s)=\frac{6Ks}{s^2+2s+5}[/latex] The point at which root locus enters real axis (break away point) is given by [latex]\frac{dK}{ds}=0 [/latex] [latex]K=-\frac{(s^2+2s+5)}{6s} [/latex] [latex]\frac{dK}{ds}=0\;\Rightarrow \;s=\pm \sqrt{5} [/latex] [latex]\therefore \;\;s=-\sqrt{5}[/latex]

question:
Question 37 For the synchronous sequential circuit shown below, the output Z is zero for the initial
conditions  [latex]Q_{A}Q_{B}Q_{C}=Q_{A}'Q_{B}'Q'_{C}=100[/latex] The minimum number of clock cycles after which the output Z would again become zero is ________
solution: The output Z will again become zero after 6th clock cycle.

question:
Question 38 In the circuit shown below, the value of capacitor C required for maximum power to be
transferred to the load is
solution: The frequency at which the load is resistive and it is equal to [latex]0.5\Omega[/latex] i.e. The load is resistive means, the imaginary part of load is equal to zero and real part is equal to [latex]0.5\Omega[/latex]. [latex]Z_{load}=\frac{1 \times \frac{1}{Cs}}{1 + \frac{1}{Cs}}+Ls[/latex] [latex]\;\;=\frac{1}{1+Cs}+Ls[/latex] [latex]\;\; =\frac{(1-Cs)}{1-C^2s^2}+Ls [/latex] Put,  [latex] s=j\omega[/latex]; [latex] Z_{load}=\frac{1-j\omega C}{1+C^2\omega ^2}+j\omega L [/latex] [latex]\;\;\;=\frac{1}{1+C^2\omega ^2}+j\omega \left ( L-\frac{C}{(1+C^2\omega ^2)} \right ) [/latex] Real part of the [latex]Z_{load}=\frac{1}{1+C^2\omega ^2}=0.5 [/latex] Putting, [latex]\omega =100 r/s[/latex] we get, [latex]C=10mF[/latex]

question:
Question 39 In the circuit shown all elements are ideal and the switch S is operated at 10 kHz and 60% duty
ratio. The capacitor is large enough so that the ripple across it is negligible and at steady state
acquires a voltage as shown. The peak current in amperes drawn from the 50 V DC source is
________. (Give the answer up to one decimal place.)
solution: Buckboost converter, [latex]\begin{aligned} V_0&=\frac{\alpha V_s}{1-\alpha }\\ V_s&=50V\\ \alpha &=0.6\\ V_0&=75V\\ \frac{V_0}{V_s}&=\frac{I_s}{I_0}=\frac{\alpha }{1-\alpha }\\ &=\frac{0.6}{1-0.6}=\frac{3}{2}\\ I_0&=\frac{V_0}{R}=\frac{75}{5}=15A\\ I_s&=\frac{\alpha }{1-\alpha }I_0=\frac{3}{2} \times 15=22.5A \end{aligned}[/latex] Since capacitor is very large [latex]i_c=0[/latex] at steady state [latex]\begin{aligned} (i_L)_{avg}&=(I_s)_{avg}+(i_0)_{avg}\\ I_L&=I_s+I_0\\ I_L&=22.5+15=37.5A\\ \Delta I_L&=\frac{\alpha V_s}{fL}\\ &=\frac{0.6\times 50}{10 \times 10^3 \times (0.6 \times 10^{-3})}\\ &=5A\\ (i_L)_{peak}&=I_L+\frac{\Delta I_L}{2}\\ &=37.5+\frac{5}{2}=40A \end{aligned}[/latex] Peak value of current drawn from source [latex]=(i_L)_{peak}=40A[/latex]

question:
Question 40 In the circuit shown in the figure, the diode used is ideal. The input power factor is _______.
(Give the answer up to two decimal places.)
solution: [latex]\begin{aligned} PF&=\frac{V_{or}}{V_{sr}}=\frac{V_m/2}{V_m/\sqrt{2}} \\ &=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}=0.707 \end{aligned}[/latex]

question: Question 41 Consider the system described by the following state space representation [latex]\begin{bmatrix} \dot{x_{1}(t)}\\ \dot{x_{2}(t)} \end{bmatrix}=\begin{bmatrix} 0 & 1\\ 0&-2 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} {x_{1}(t)}\\ {x_{2}(t)} \end{bmatrix} +\begin{bmatrix} 0\\ 1 \end{bmatrix} u(t)[/latex] [latex]  y(t)=\begin{bmatrix} 1 &0 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} {x_{1}(t)}\\ {x_{2}(t)} \end{bmatrix}[/latex] If u(t) is a unit step input and [latex]\begin{bmatrix} {x_{1}(0)}\\ {x_{2}(0)} \end{bmatrix}=\begin{bmatrix} 1\\ 0 \end{bmatrix}[/latex], the value of output y(t) at t = 1 sec (rounded off to three decimal places) is_________
solution: [latex]y(t)=\begin{bmatrix} 1 &0 \end{bmatrix}x(t) [/latex] [latex]x(t)=L^{-1}[(sI-A)^{-1}]x(0)+L^{-1}[(sI-A)^{-1}]BU(s) [/latex] [latex]L^{-1}[(sI-A)^{-1}]x(0)=\begin{bmatrix} 1\\ 0 \end{bmatrix} [/latex] [latex]L^{-1}[(sI-A)^{-1}]BU(s)=\begin{bmatrix} -0.25+0.5t+0.25e^{-2t}\\ 0.5-0.5e^{-2t} \end{bmatrix} [/latex] [latex]\therefore \;\; x(t)=\begin{bmatrix} 0.75+0.5t+0.25e^{-2t}\\ 0.5-0.5e^{-2t} \end{bmatrix} [/latex] [latex]\therefore \;\; y(t)=0.75+0.5t+0.25e^{-2t} [/latex] [latex]\therefore \;\;y(1)=1.284[/latex]

question:
Question 42 A star-connected, 12.5 kW, 208 V (line), 3-phase, 60 Hz squirrel cage induction motor has
following equivalent circuit parameters per phase referred to the stator: [latex]R_{1}=0.3\Omega ,R_{2}=0.3\Omega ,X_{1}=0.41\Omega ,X_{2}=0.41\Omega[/latex]. Neglect shunt branch in the equivalent circuit. The starting current (in Ampere) for this motor when connected to an 80 V (line), 20 Hz, 3-phase AC source is __________.
solution: Equivalent circuit representation during starting -according to question Total resistance to stator [latex]=0.6\Omega[/latex] Total reactance reference to stator [latex]=0.82\Omega[/latex] Reactance for [latex]60Hz \;\rightarrow \;0.82\Omega[/latex] Reactance for [latex]60Hz \;\rightarrow ?[/latex] [latex]\because \;\; X_e\propto F [/latex] Reactance for [latex]20Hz\;\Rightarrow \; \frac{20}{60} \times 0.82 [/latex] [latex]\therefore \;\;[/latex] X for 20 Hz frequency[latex] =0.273\Omega[/latex] [latex] \therefore \;\;[/latex] Starting current [latex] \Rightarrow \;\; I_{st}=\frac{80\sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{(0.6)^2+(0.273)^2}}=70.05A[/latex]

question:
Question 43 A 25 kVA, 400 V, [latex]\Delta[/latex]-connected, 3-phase, cylindrical rotor synchronous generator requires a field current of 5A to maintain the rated armature current under short-circuit condition. For the same field current, the open-circuit voltage is 360 V. Neglecting the armature resistance and
magnetic saturation, its voltage regulation (in % with respect to terminal voltage), when the
generator delivers the rated load at 0.8 pf leading, at rated terminal voltage is _________.
solution: 25 kVA, 400 V, [latex]\Delta -[/latex]synchronous generator [latex]\begin{aligned} \therefore \;\; I_{rated} &=\frac{25000}{\sqrt{3}\times 400}=36.085A \\ I_{phase}&=\frac{36.085}{\sqrt{3}}=20.83A \\ X_3 &=\left.\begin{matrix} \frac{V_{OC}}{I_{a_{rated}}} \end{matrix}\right|_{I_{f_{same}}} \\ \therefore \;\;X_s &= \frac{360}{20.83}=17.28\Omega /phase\\ E &=\sqrt{(V \cos \phi +I_aR_a)^2+(V \sin \phi -I_aX_s)^2} \\ &=\sqrt{(400 \times 0.8)^2 +(400 \times 0.6 - 20.83(17.28))^2} \\ &=\sqrt{(102400)+(240-360)^2} \\ &= 341.76V\\ \therefore \;\; \% V.R. &= \frac{E-V}{V} \times 100\\ &=\frac{341.76-400}{400} \times 100=-14.56\% \end{aligned}[/latex]

question: Question 44 If the primary line voltage rating is 3.3 kV (Y side) of a 25 kVA. Y-[latex]\Delta[/latex] transformer (the per phase turns ratio is 5:1), then the line current rating of the secondary side (in Ampere) is_____.
solution: From turn ratio, [latex]\begin{aligned} V_2 &=381 V/phase \\ V_{2 \; line}&= 381 V\\ \sqrt{3} V_2I_2&= 25000\\ \therefore \;\; I_2&=\frac{25000}{\sqrt{3} \times 381}=37.88A \end{aligned}[/latex]

question:
Question 45 For the balanced Y-Y connected 3-Phase circuit shown in the figure below, the line-line voltage
is 208 V rms and the total power absorbed by the load is 432 W at a power factor of 0.6 leading. The approximate value of the impedance Z is
solution: For star connection, [latex]\begin{aligned} P_{3-\phi }&=\left | \frac{V_L^2}{z} \right | \cos \phi \\ Z&=\frac{V_L^2}{P_{3-\phi }} \cos \phi \\ &=\frac{208^2 }{430} \times 0.6 \\ \cos \phi &=0.6 \text{ lead}\\ \phi &=53.13^{\circ}\\ \therefore \; Z&=60\angle -53.13^{\circ}\Omega \end{aligned}[/latex]

question:
Question 46 A thin soap bubble of radius R = 1 cm, and thickness [latex]a=3.3\mu m(a\lt \lt R)[/latex], is at a potential of 1 V with respect to a reference point at infinity. The bubble bursts and becomes a single spherical
drop of soap (assuming all the soap is contained in the drop) of radius r. The volume of the soap
in the thin bubble is [latex]4\pi R^{2}a[/latex] and that of the drop is [latex]\frac{4}{3} \pi r^{3}[/latex]. The potential in volts, of the resulting single spherical drop with respect to the same reference point at infinity is __________. (Give the answer up to two decimal places.)
solution: After burst, [latex]4 \pi R^2 a=\frac{4}{3}\pi r^3[/latex] Radius of soap drop [latex]=(3 R^2a)^{1/3}=0.099665cm[/latex] Initial voltage was 1 V and [latex]C=4 \pi \varepsilon _0R[/latex] and initial charge, [latex]Q=(4 \pi \varepsilon _0R \times 1)[/latex] Since after bursting Q remainsame and [latex]C=4 \pi \varepsilon _0r[/latex] New potential on soap drop, [latex]V=\frac{Q}{C}=\frac{4 \pi \varepsilon _0R}{4 \pi \varepsilon _0r}=\frac{1}{0.099665}=10.03V[/latex]

question: Question 47 The value of the contour integral in the complex-plane [latex]\oint \frac{z^{3}-2z+3}{z-2}dz[/latex] Along the contour |Z|=3, taken counter-clockwise is
solution: Pole, z=2 lies inside |z|=3 [latex]\text{Res }f(z)=\lim_{z \to 2}(z-2)\frac{z^2-2z+3}{z-2}[/latex] [latex]z=2, \;\;\;\;\; =8-4+3=7[/latex] By Cauche redisue theorem, [latex]I=2 \pi i (7)=14 \pi i[/latex]

question: Question 48 Let [latex]g(x)=\left\{\begin{matrix} -x & x\leq 1\\ x+1, &x\geq 1 \end{matrix}\right. [/latex]  and [latex]f(x)=\left\{\begin{matrix} 1-x & x\leq 0\\ x^{2}, & x \gt 0 \end{matrix}\right.[/latex] Consider the composition of f and g, i.e., [latex](f\circ g)(x)=f(g(x))[/latex]. The number of discontinuities in [latex](f\circ g)(x)[/latex] present in the interval [latex](-\infty ,0)[/latex] is:
solution: [latex]\begin{aligned} f(x)=1-x; &x \lt 0\\ g(x)=-x;&x \lt 0 \end{aligned}[/latex] (Noth are continous for [latex]x \lt 0[/latex]) Therefore, fog(x) is continous for [latex]x \lt 0[/latex] The composite function of two continous function is always continous . Therefore the number of discontinuities are zero.

question:
Question 49 A 120 V DC shunt motor takes 2 A at no load. It takes 7 A on full load while running at 1200
rpm. The armature resistance is 0.8 [latex]\Omega[/latex] , and the shunt field resistance is 240[latex]\Omega[/latex] . The no load speed, in rpm, is _______________.
solution: Shunt motor take 7A  on full load and runs at 1200 rpm. [latex]\begin{aligned} \therefore \; E_{b1} &=120-65(0.8) \\ E_{b1} &= 114.8V\\ N_1&=1200\;\text{rpm} \end{aligned}[/latex] Shunt motor takes 2A at no load [latex]\begin{aligned} E_{b2} &=120-1.5(0.8)=118.8 \\ & \text{For shunt motor,}\\ \frac{N_2}{N_1} &= \frac{E_{b2}}{E_{b1}}\\ \therefore \; N_2&=\frac{118.8}{114.8}\times 1200\\ &=1241.81 \text{rpm} \end{aligned}[/latex]

question:
Question 50 A [latex]10\frac{1}{2}[/latex] digit timer counter possesses a base clock of frequency 100 MHz. When measuring a
particular input, the reading obtained is the same in: (i) Frequency mode of operation with a
gating time of one second and (ii) Period mode of operation (in the x 10 ns scale). The
frequency of the unknown input (reading obtained) in Hz is _______.
solution: [latex]1.\;\;10\frac{1}{2}[/latex] digital time counter: Frequency mode of operation: [latex]f=\frac{n}{t}[/latex] Let f = frequency of input signal n = number of cycles of repetitive signal [latex]\Rightarrow \;\;100 \times 10^6 [/latex] Let [latex] t \Rightarrow[/latex] Gate time [latex]\Rightarrow \;t=1 sec. [/latex] [latex]f=\frac{100 \times 10^6}{1 sec}=10^8 Hz [/latex] [latex]\;\;=10^8 cycles/sec[/latex] On [latex]10\frac{1}{2}[/latex] digit display [latex]100000000.00Hz[/latex] [latex] 2.\;\; \text{Period mode of operation:}[/latex] [latex]P=\frac{1}{f}=\frac{t}{n}=\frac{1sec}{100 \times 10^6}[/latex] Let P=Period of input signal [latex]P=0.01 \times 10^{-6}[/latex] [latex]\;\;=10 \times 10^{-9}[/latex] [latex]\;\;=1 \times 10n-sec[/latex] [latex]\;\;=10.000000000 n-sec[/latex]

question:
Question 51 A person decides to toss a fair coin repeatedly until he gets a head. He will make at most 3
tosses. Let the random variable Y denote the number of heads. The value of var {Y}, where
var {.} denotes the variance, equals
solution: [latex]\begin{aligned} E(y)&=0\times \frac{1}{8}+1 \times \frac{7}{8}=\frac{7}{8} \\ E(y^2) &=0^2\left ( \frac{1}{8} \right )+1^2 \times \frac{7}{8}=\frac{7}{8} \\ \text{Variance(y)} &=E(y^2)-(E(y))^2 \\ &= \frac{7}{8}-\frac{49}{64}=\frac{56-49}{64}=\frac{7}{64} \end{aligned}[/latex]

question: Question 52 The figure below shows a half-bridge voltage source inverter supplying an RL-load with [latex]R=40\Omega[/latex] and [latex]L=(\frac{0.3}{\pi })H[/latex]. The desired fundamental frequency of the load voltage is 50 Hz. The switch control signals of the converter are generated using sinusoidal pulse width modulation with modulation index. M = 0.6. At 50 Hz, the RL-load draws an active power of 1.44 kW. The value of DC source voltage [latex]V_{DC}[/latex] in volts is
solution:
[latex]\begin{aligned} V_{01 peak}&=M\cdot \frac{V_s}{2} \;\;\;M\rightarrow \text{Modulation index}\\ V_{01peak}&=\frac{M\cdot \frac{V_s}{2}}{\sqrt{2}}=M\cdot \frac{V_s}{2\sqrt{2}}\\ V_{01peak}&=\frac{0.6V_s}{2\sqrt{2}} \end{aligned}[/latex] [latex]\begin{aligned}
V_{01}&=\frac{0.3}{\sqrt{2}}V_s\\
|Z_1|&=\sqrt{R^2+(\omega L)^2}\\
&=\sqrt{40^2+(2 \pi f L)^2}\\
&=\sqrt{40^2+\left (2 \pi \times 50 \times \frac{0.3}{\pi}  \right )^2}\\
&=\sqrt{40^2+30^2}=50\\
\phi _1&=\tan ^{-1}\frac{\omega L}{R}=\tan ^{-1}\frac{30}{40}=36.896^{\circ}\\
\text{Active power} &=V_{01}I_{01} \cos \phi \\
&=V_{01}\frac{V_{01}}{|Z_1|} \cos \phi \\
1.44 \times 10^3&=\left (\frac{0.3}{\sqrt{2}}V_s  \right )^2\cdot \frac{1}{50}(\cos 36.896^{\circ} )\\
\therefore \;\;V_s^2&=\frac{1.44 \times 10^3 \times 100}{0.3^2 (0.8)}\\
&=20 \times 10^5\\
V_s&=\sqrt{2} \cdot 10^3=1000\sqrt{2}\\
V_{DC}&=\frac{V_s}{2}=500\sqrt{2}V
\end{aligned}[/latex]

question: Question 53 The range of K for which all the roots of the equation [latex]s^{3}+3s^{2}+2s+K=0[/latex] are in the left half of the complex s-plane is
solution: From the given equation, [latex]s^3+3s^2+2s+K=0[/latex] Using Routh's criterion, we get [latex]K \lt 6[/latex] and [latex]K \gt 0[/latex] or [latex]0 \lt K \lt 6[/latex]

question: Question 54 The eigen values of the matrix given below are [latex]\begin{bmatrix} 0 & 1&0 \\ 0& 0 & 1\\ 0 &-3 & -4 \end{bmatrix}[/latex]
solution: The characteristics equation is [latex]|A-\lambda |i=0.[/latex] [latex]\begin{aligned} \begin{bmatrix} 0-\lambda & 1 & 0\\ 0 & 0-\lambda & 1\\ 0& -3 &-4-\lambda \end{bmatrix}&=0 \\ -\lambda (4\lambda +\lambda ^2+3)-1(0-0)&=0 \\ -\lambda (\lambda ^2+4\lambda +3)&=0 \\ \lambda =0,(\lambda +1)(\lambda +3)&=0 \\ \lambda &=-1,-3 \\ \lambda &=(0,-1,-3) \end{aligned}[/latex]

question:
Question 55 A 3-phase 50 Hz generator supplies power of 3MW at 17.32 kV to a balanced 3-phase inductive
load through an overhead line. The per phase line resistance and reactance are
0.25[latex]\Omega[/latex] and 3.925[latex]\Omega[/latex] respectively. If the voltage at the generator terminal is 17.87 kV, the power factor of the load is ________
solution: [latex]\begin{aligned} V_S-V_R&=I(R \cos \phi +X_L \sin \phi) \\I &=\frac{P_R}{V_R \cos \phi } \\ V_S-V_R&= \frac{P_R}{V_R \cos \phi } (R \cos \phi +X_L \sin \phi )\\ \tan \phi &= \left ( \frac{V_SV_R-V_R^2-RP_R}{X_LP_R} \right )\\ \phi &=\tan ^{-1} \left [\frac{V_SV_R-V_R^2-RP_R}{X_LP_R} \right ]\\ &\;\Rightarrow \;\text{substitute all values} \\ \text{power factor} &= \cos \phi =0.8 \; \text{lag} \end{aligned}[/latex]
